image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Nevada; born in Lovelock, Pershing County, Nev., December 27, 1903; attended the public schools; was graduated from Elko County High School in 1922 and the University of Nevada at Reno in 1926; taught school in 1926 and 1927; employed in a mine office in Ruth, Nev., in 1928 and 1929; editor of a newspaper since 1929; served in the State assembly 1935-1940; member of the State senate 1941-1946, resigning in 1946 to become a candidate for Congress; served as president pro tempore of the State senate in 1943; elected as a Republican to the Eightieth Congress (January 3, 1947-January 3, 1949); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1948 to the Eighty-first Congress; member of the staff of the Joint Congressional Committee on Foreign Economic Cooperation in Washington, D.C., in 1949 and 1950; Governor of Nevada from January 1, 1951, to January 5, 1959; director of International Cooperation Administration mission to Paraguay December 15, 1959, serving until July 1, 1963; assistant to president of University of Nevada, August 1963 to January 1, 1968; was a resident of Carson City, Nev., until his death there on September 13, 1989.

researchRecord.name: 1947-1958, 8 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Charles Hinton Russell consist primarily of scrapbooks. Also include are administrative files for his terms as U.S. Representative and governor, and photos. Other materials consist of scrapbooks with newsclippings, administrative files of correspondence, reports, and Governors' Conferences materials.

researchRecord.name: In the Vail Montgomery Pittman Executive Records, 1945-1950, 31 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Charles Hinton Russell.

researchRecord.name: 1951-1958, 130 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The collection contains executive records of Charles Hinton Russell when he served as Governor of Nevada from 1951 to1958. Included are various communications related to his functions as Nevada's chief executive, and with state boards and commissions, as well as federal agencies, government officials and private individuals.
